title: Three things to know when there's a katarina on your team.
body:
1. She isn't a tank, she isn't a fighter, she's an assassin, she is squishier than an ADC for most of the game and dies really easily when she's camped or alone.(by this i mean she only brings damage to teamfights, just like an ADC which means she needs someone to tank for her, and CC for her. If she doesn't have that, she's the same as telling your squishy jinx to go 1v5, regardless of how fed she is, she'll probably die) 
2. She isn't meant to engage for you, not on a 5v5 teamfight, it's not her job, she'll just die and do nothing, then you'll flame her for feeding or split pushing when you haven't been trying to help her. She's a teamfight assassin, if she doesn't have a team, she's nothing.
3. For the love of all that is holy, pick someone with engage, anyone, katarina cannot engage for you, she can't keep going in alone because she'll keep feeding, you need to engage for her so she can finish the fight quickly. 

~Your neighborhood Katarina main who can't win a game right now because no one wants to engage.

Same. Had a team comp whose hard CC consisted of Charm and Fling. When the enemy team second picked Yi. And also picked Kog Maw and Fizz. Not enough CC.
Part of your problem was also 2 assassins and 1 tank. And no utility. That's less CC and more nobody to keep the team alive.

My team was Ahri, Mundo, Singed, Lucian and Soraka.  I don't see any primary Assassins there. I also only see one Assassin on the enemy team of Yi, Graves, Fizz, Kogmaw, and and Janna. In teamfights, we could only pick one of the three to kill while the other two ran rampant.
The way you phrased it made it seem as though your team picked ahri, singed, yi, kog and fizz
Fixed.

Oh. ENEMY team picked Fizz. That makes far more sense. So you have Soraka as utility. That's it. You need a bit more than that. However, you've got everything else down. I'd like to mention that Raka's E is hard CC, as well (interrupts all channels, has a silence, AoE, damage, and snare).

And Ahri's basically an assassin, just like LeBlanc. Even if she's a _primary_ mage, she's still basically an assassin. Just an assassin that tends to suck against assassins.

Well. A lack of CC wouldn't have been your primary issue. Singed and Raka both have hard and soft CC, Ahri has hard, Mundo has soft. Their team only had Janna with hard CC, Kog has soft, Grave's smokescreen is just an annoyance, Fizz _might_ have a slow (I honestly just avoid almost everything of his, so I don't find out), and Yi has no CC at all. Your team had more CC, and had actual tanks. All you had to do was lock Fizz down, use exhaust on Yi, slow and kill Kog, kill Yi, Fizz (if he's not already dead), Janna, then Graves. Against that team, one Thornmail would have saved you from 3 of them easily.

And Ahri wouldn't have been stopped by anyone, since they would have had no tank, so she should have been able to carry the game.

Then again, I'm only bronze, so maybe I'm missing something. But it seems, to me, that would have worked. But I also had no idea about any of the scores. So maybe I'm wrong. But you didn't need to CC their entire team at once, only the biggest threat at the time.


If the Ahri had stayed back, harassing with Q, until Fizz dove in (in which case, she should delete him), then focused on Kog (or Yi, depending on if he's already ulted or not), then systematically eliminated everyone. Graves would have been her biggest problem after their burst (Yi and Fizz, specifically. Yes, I count Yi as burst. He's like an auto-attacking assassin, basically) died, assuming nobody on their team was fed, since Graves would have been most of their tank (except for maybe a lifesteal-heavy Yi, if you count that), but Singed and Lucian would have been enough for him.

That's assuming equal gold. My Mundo tower dove the Fizz at level 3. when Fizz had E and summoners up. Yes, Mundo died. And then was useless all game.

Meanwhile the Yi was hyperfed. The CC was an issue because we had to pick between Yi, Fizz, or Kog to lockdown and kill. Fizz was the worst choice, he was awful, but he's still Fizz and can throw heat seeking sharks. So that left Yi or Kog and we could only kill one reliably, while the other destroyed everyone. It didn't help that Mundo, Soraka and Singed fed their asses off, whereas Lucian and I were the only saving grace, but we still can't win against a fed Yi and Kog with just the two of us, let alone a Fizz thrown in the mix.

I wouldn't say it's just with kat. Soloq often leaves people with the mentality that they have to be the one who carries the game, which ends up leaving team comps with no tank or reliable front line. People are too tunneled on carrying that they fail to really strategize and observe during champ select and say "my team doesn't have a frontline" maybe I should pick a tank. Now I understand that people have their comfort picks, and skill and experience on a champ weigh in heavily, but there comes a point where you have to figure out where to draw the line. Of course, Juggernauts are actually pretty good at fitting into almost any comp.

Who said juggernaughts cant initiate? 
{{summoner:4}} {{item:3142}} {{item:3800}} {{item:3742}}

Most of them act more like divers than initiators, with more focus on damage than CC and single target over AoE.

Then again, death is the strongest CC, and the only thing squishier than the carries are sometimes the supports ...

Darius has tons of AoE and CC, and so does Cho
Morde has tons of AoE, and so does Garen
Nasus yeah, he might be lackluster in terms of AOE and CC, but he can soak CC well so your Kata can jump in and press R to win.

Cho's more of a mage / juggernaut, I'd say, and Kat isn't one at all.

As far as Darius, Garen, and Morde, I guess they _do_ have tons of AoE if you only play assassins and Urgot and Darius has tons of CC if you've never seen a tank before. Morde and Darius do have a decent AoE, yeah, but Darius gets it from one ability while Morde's W mostly only gets to shine as an AoE ability vs. minion waves or an enemy team that just got caught by a Malphite ult. The same goes for Garen spin ... except that's his only AoE, meaning he's basically entirely single target unless his team or the enemy team _lets_ him AoE it up.

And for CC ... Darius has a long-cooldown short-distance pull, and a one second slow. Unless you're agreeing with me that death is some really great CC, then I'm not seeing it. Skarner is really what I'd hold up as a CC-heavy juggernaut, since he actually has a kinda spammable stun and his pull, while single-target, can yank someone a loooooot farther. Still, he's only CC-heavy for a _juggernaut_, and that's kinda his niche in the role. Hell, he doesn't so much initiate as dive, then reverse-dive with someone in tow.

She has high HP cause she's a mid lane assassin and needed it to deal with the ranged champions. (a good thing to do for a kat main is to take her top against teemo or quinn)

Renekton's health and armor catch up by 6 and 7, respectively, meaning he ultimately has more base tankiness for most of the game, but that curve makes sense: Renekton has sustain, like you mentioned, _and_ doesn't have to deal with his main lane being against ranged while he's melee. Kat does.
